The Times of Israel liveblogged Saturdayâ€™s events as they unfolded.

[3:40 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/rocket-sirens-sound-in-sderot-kibbutz-nir-am/)

#### [Rocket sirens sound in Sderot, Kibbutz Nir Am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/rocket-sirens-sound-in-sderot-kibbutz-nir-am/)

Sirens warning of incoming rocket attacks sound again in southern Israel. They are heard in Sderot, Kibbutz Nir Am, Yad Mordechai, and Netiv Haâ€™asara, all near the Gaza Strip.

Earlier overnight, a home in Sderot suffered a direct rocket hit, causing no injuries but significant damage.

[3:17 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/sderot-mayor-decries-massacre-of-innocent-civilians-calls-to-erase-hamas/)

#### [Sderot mayor decries â€˜massacre of innocent civilians,â€™ calls to erase Hamas](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/sderot-mayor-decries-massacre-of-innocent-civilians-calls-to-erase-hamas/)

Sderot Mayor Alon Davidi tells residents to stay in their homes behind locked doors and not open them until instructed otherwise, as Israeli security forces work to find and apprehend an unknown number of Palestinian terrorists who infiltrated this morning from Gaza into Israeli communities and gunned down people in the streets and in their homes.

Davidi decries the â€œmassacre of innocent civilians everywhere,â€ and calls for Israelâ€™s leadership to deal a significant blow to Hamas.

â€œWe need to take over Gaza and kill them, they need to be erased,â€ he tells Channel 12.

[3:07 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/rocket-sirens-sound-in-kibbutz-beeri-where-israeli-forces-battle-palestinian-terrorists/)

#### [Rocket sirens sound in Kibbutz Beâ€™eri where Israeli forces battle Palestinian terrorists](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/rocket-sirens-sound-in-kibbutz-beeri-where-israeli-forces-battle-palestinian-terrorists/)

Sirens warning of incoming rockets are sounding in Kibbutz Beâ€™eri in southern Israel where Israeli security forces and Palestinian terrorists who infiltrated into the kibbutz from Gaza are engaged in a gun battle.

Hebrew media reports say Israeli forces are still working to clear the kibbutz of terrorists and exchanges of gunfire can be heard.

Earlier, dozens of people were rescued from the kibbutz dining hall where they were held hostage for hours. According to public broadcaster Kan, at least 48 people were rescued in the incident.

[3:02 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/woman-seriously-injured-in-rocket-hit-in-ashkelon-five-more-lightly-wounded/)

#### [Woman seriously injured in rocket hit in Ashkelon, five more lightly wounded](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/woman-seriously-injured-in-rocket-hit-in-ashkelon-five-more-lightly-wounded/)

The Magen David Adom ambulance services says a 50-year-old woman was seriously injured in a rocket attack in Ashkelon tonight, and five other sustained light injuries.

The Barzilai Medical Center in the city was hit by a rocket launched from the Gaza Strip amid the ongoing, unprecedented attack on Israel.

[2:44 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/barzilai-hospital-in-ashkelon-suffers-rocket-hit-no-injuries-reported/)

#### [Barzilai hospital in Ashkelon suffers rocket hit; no injuries reported](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/barzilai-hospital-in-ashkelon-suffers-rocket-hit-no-injuries-reported/)

The Barzilai Medical Center in the southern city of Ashkelon is hit by a rocket fired from the Gaza Strip. The rocket struck a bridge between buildings at the hospital.

There are no immediate reports of injuries, but significant damage was sustained, a hospital official tells Channel 12.

[2:39 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/israeli-hostages-rescued-in-ofakim-terrorists-killed/)

#### [Two Israeli hostages rescued in Ofakim; terrorists killed](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/israeli-hostages-rescued-in-ofakim-terrorists-killed/)

Two Israelis who were taken hostage in a home in the southern town of Ofakim have been rescued by Israeli security forces, according to Hebrew-language media.

Four terrorists at the home were killed, according to the reports. At least one member of Israelâ€™s security forces was injured.

[2:35 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/security-cabinet-says-israel-will-destroy-military-governmental-abilities-of-hamas-islamic-jihad/)

#### [Security cabinet says Israel will destroy military, governmental abilities of Hamas, Islamic Jihad](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/security-cabinet-says-israel-will-destroy-military-governmental-abilities-of-hamas-islamic-jihad/)

By [ToI Staff](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/times-of-israel-staff/ "ToI Staff")

His office says Israelâ€™s response will take away â€œtheir ability and desire to threaten and harm the citizens of Israel for many years.â€

Among the decisions made by the cabinet are stopping the supply of electricity, fuel and goods to the Gaza Strip.

Dozens of civilians as well as IDF soldiers are believed to have been abducted and brought into Gaza; Hamas has boasted that the number of hostages is higher than Israel knows.

â€œIsrael has a right to defend itself and its people. Full stop.â€

â€œWe remain deeply aligned,â€ said the official, adding that Israelâ€™s response is likely to continue â€œfor some time.

The official says that that US will continue to â€œwork with parties throughout the regionâ€ to make sure the fighting doesnâ€™t spread from Gaza.

â€œThat process has a ways to travel,â€ says the official, adding that â€œterrorist groups like Hamas will not derail any such outcome.â€

Illustrative -- A vehicle blocks road near Nahal Oz in southern Israel on March 25, 2019. (Hadas Parush/Flash90)

Maj.-Gen. (retired) Noam Tibon describes to Channel 12 going to Kibbutz Nahal Oz and, together with IDF troops, â€œsaving my familyâ€ whose home was surrounded by terrorists from Gaza.

He tells Channel 12 that the troops killed several terrorists and rescued his son and grandchildren.

His son, Amir, a journalist for Haaretz, posts on the social media platform X that his â€œheroicâ€ father came from Tel Aviv, â€œled the troopsâ€ to the familyâ€™s home and â€œhelped kill the terrorists.â€

Amir also praises his daughters for staying quiet in the house for hours before they were rescued. â€œWe are praying for the neighbors who are missing and injured.â€

Eleven Nepalese agricultural students have been injured, two of them seriously, in the Hamas attack on southern Israel, according to a statement by the Nepalese Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

Nepalâ€™s ambassador to Israel tells CNN that when the attack began, the students were working on a farm in the area. They hid in a bomb shelter but that building was taken over by Hamas.

Separate unconfirmed reports in the Hindustani Times and India Today state that some Nepalese students are also among those who have been taken hostage by Hamas.

[11:54 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/germany-france-step-up-security-at-jewish-sites-amid-israel-war/)

#### [Germany, France step up security at Jewish sites amid Israel war](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/germany-france-step-up-security-at-jewish-sites-amid-israel-war/)

By [AFP](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/afp/ "AFP")

[![A French officer stands guard near a synagogue in Marseille on November 3, 2020. (Christophe SIMON / AFP)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2023/05/8UG8RN-highres-640x400.jpg "A French officer stands guard near a synagogue in Marseille on November 3, 2020. (Christophe SIMON / AFP)")](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/germany-france-step-up-security-at-jewish-sites-amid-israel-war/)

Illustrative: A French officer stands guard near a synagogue in Marseille on November 3, 2020. (Christophe SIMON / AFP)

Germany and France move to reinforce security around Jewish temples, schools and monuments after the surprise attack by Hamas against Israel.

Germany tightens police protection of Jewish and Israeli institutions, as some supporters of the Palestinians took to the streets of Berlin to celebrate the attack.

France is focusing on Jewish temples and schools in cities across the country, as one Jewish leader expresses concern at the possibility the conflict might be imported there.

â€œIn Berlin, police protection has been immediately stepped up,â€ Germanyâ€™s Interior Minister Nancy Faeser tells Bild newspaper. â€œThe federal government and the regions are closely coordinating their actions.â€

Germanyâ€™s authorities are also closely watching â€œpotential supporters of Hamas in the Islamist sphere,â€ she adds.

In France, security had already been stepped up at synagogues in Paris, Marseille, Lyon and Strasbourg because of the holiday period being observed since late September.

Interior Minister Gerald Darmanin sends an urgent message to prefects running the countryâ€™s regions asking them to reinforce surveillance even further.

â€œAt a time when terrorist attacks from Gaza are hitting Israel, I ask you to immediately step up vigilance, security and protection of Jewish community sites in France,â€ he writes in a message seen by AFP.

He called for a â€œvisible and systematic static presence,â€ and the use of soldiers from Franceâ€™s Operation Sentinelle, a special force deployed across the country since the 2015 terror attacks. The interior ministry will review the security situation at a special meeting tomorrow.

[11:44 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/hamas-official-our-attack-has-only-just-begun/)

#### [Hamas official: Our attack has only just begun](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/hamas-official-our-attack-has-only-just-begun/)

By [Gianluca Pacchiani](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/gianluca-pacchiani/ "Gianluca Pacchiani")

Hussam Badran, a member of the political bureau of Hamas, says the terror groupâ€™s onslaught is only in its early stages.

Badran says the attack, called the â€œAl-Aqsa Delugeâ€ by the terror group, comes after careful preparation aimed at catching Israel by surprise.

The terror leader says this battle is different from all previous rounds of conflict, and calls on Arab mediators to convey to Israel that it must â€œleave our occupied lands.â€

He adds that Hamas does not expect them to be mediators but rather supporters of its position.

Like a number of Hamas leaders who have issued statements today, Badran claims the attack is motivated by Israeli control over the flashpoint Al-Aqsa mosque in Jerusalem.

The mosque, the third holiest site for Muslims, sits atop the Temple Mount, the holiest site for Jews as the location of the biblical temples. Israel has long maintained a delicate status quo at the site, in which Jews are allowed to visit during limited hours, but not pray. Terror groups have repeatedly used baseless claims of Israeli intentions to take over the mosque as a pretext for violence.

Badran also blames Israeli policies in the West Bank and its treatment of Palestinian prisoners for the attack, adding that â€œwe are the owners of this land, and this occupation will not last forever.â€

The surprise onslaught against Israel has killed at least 250 Israelis, including many civilians, and injured over 1,000. An unspecified number of Israelis, living and dead, are held hostage by terrorists in Gaza.

Irish deputy premier and foreign affairs minister Micheal Martin condemns the attack by Hamas on Israeli citizens, and says it is â€œvital that the voice of moderation comes to the fore.â€

Martin says he could â€œsee tensions risingâ€ during a recent trip to the region, and that the scale of todayâ€™s attack is â€œquite shocking.â€

â€œWe believe a two-state solution remains the only sensible and rational solution to this issue and it needs political momentum behind it,â€ he says.

â€œMy sense is that the hardliners are growing in influence, and thatâ€™s why I believe the need to have moderate voices in the center is key,â€ he says.

â€œSo what we need really is a political peace process to get on track in a serious way. That will mean I think, international intervention as well to facilitate that, but itâ€™s a very, very complex and difficult situation and there will be many consequences to todayâ€™s attack.â€

[![An illustrative photo of a court room in the Supreme Court in Jerusalem, August 1, 2023. An illustrative photo of a court room in the Supreme Court in Jerusalem, August 1, 2023. (Chaim Goldberg/FLASH90)

Israelâ€™s courts will operate on an emergency footing tomorrow and will only hold hearings on urgent matters due to the Hamas invasion of southern Israel and the war with Gaza, it announces.

A statement put out by the Israel Courts Administration says the decision was made by Justice Minister Yariv Levin â€œwith the knowledge of and \[in accordance with the\] opinion of Supreme Court President Justice Esther Hayut and Director of the Courts Administration Judge Michael Spitzer.â€

The decision applies to Israelâ€™s magistrates, district and labor courts, as well as the Supreme Court and the rabbinical courts.

Hearings scheduled for parole committees on Sunday will be postponed to a later date.

He is one of the most senior Israeli officers to have been killed in combat in recent memory.

Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu delivers a televised address on October 7, 2023. (Screenshot/ GPO)

In an address to the nation, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vows to use â€œall the powerâ€ of the IDF to destroy Hamasâ€™s capabilities, and tells Gazaâ€™s residents to â€œget out now.â€

Calling todayâ€™s events something â€œnever before seen in Israel,â€ he vows to ensure â€œit will never happen again.â€

He begins by saying Hamas â€œinvaded Israeli territory this morning,â€ and started a â€œcruel and evil war,â€ targeting innocent civilians young and old.

â€œWe will win this war, but the price will be unbearably heavy,â€ he says.

â€œHamas wants to murder us all,â€ Netanyahu says, â€œmurdering children and mothers in their homes, in their beds.

â€œIt is an enemy that kidnaps elderly people, children, young girls,â€ an enemy â€œthat massacres and slaughters our civilians, our children, who simply wanted to enjoy the festival.â€

â€œWhat happened today has never been seen before in Israel and I will ensure it never happens again. The entire government supports this decision. The IDF will immediately use all its power to destroy Hamasâ€™s capabilities,â€ he says. â€œWe will fight them to the bitter end and avenge this black day they plotted for Israel and its people.â€

[10:31 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/new-york-police-step-up-protection-of-jewish-communities/)

#### [New York police step up protection of Jewish communities](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/new-york-police-step-up-protection-of-jewish-communities/)

By [Luke Tress](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/luke-tress/ "Luke Tress")

New York State and New York City police have stepped up their protection of Jewish communities and synagogues, Governor Kathy Hochul says.

There are no known threats to New York Jews, she says, adding that local authorities are in touch with the FBI and other federal partners after the terror onslaught in Gaza.

Jewish security organizers have also said there are no known threats to US Jews, but are urging vigilance.

The death toll from the Hamas terror groupâ€™s massive attack on Israel rises to more than 250, Hebrew-language media reports say, citing medical officials.

The toll is expected to continue to rise.

At least 1,450 have been wounded, many seriously.

Dozens of civilians as well as IDF soldiers are believed to have been abducted and brought into Gaza; the IDF has confirmed that soldiers and civilians have been taken hostage, but has not specified a number.

Thousands of rockets have been fired at the south and center of the country, killing a number of people.

[10:07 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/mda-paramedic-aharon-haimov-father-of-2-identified-as-among-those-killed/)

#### [MDA paramedic Aharon Haimov, father of 2, identified as among those killed; was shot in his ambulance](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/mda-paramedic-aharon-haimov-father-of-2-identified-as-among-those-killed/)

By [Renee Ghert-Zand](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/renee-ghert-zand/ "Renee Ghert-Zand")

[![Aharon Haimov (Courtesy MDA)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2023/10/PHOTO-2023-10-07-14-39-01-640x400.jpg "Aharon Haimov (Courtesy MDA)")](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/mda-paramedic-aharon-haimov-father-of-2-identified-as-among-those-killed/)

Aharon Haimov (Courtesy MDA)

Magen David Adom names the senior paramedic and ambulance driver who was killed this morning as Aharon Haimov.

He died after being shot in an MDA ambulance by Palestinian terrorists as he was on his way to treat victims in his hometown of Ofakim as the coordinated attack on Israel by Hamas from Gaza unfolded.

Haimov was a 25-year-old married father of two. He also leaves behind parents, siblings and an extended family.

Haimov began his career with MDA as a post-high school volunteer. He later joined the organization in a professional capacity as an emergency medicine paramedic and ambulance driver.

In a statement, MDA says that Haimov always performed his duties in an exemplary way and was the first to respond to emergency events.

â€œHe was a person who put the good of others and the value of life ahead of everything else â€” including today, on this tragic morning,â€ says MDA director-general Eli Bin.

[9:49 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/uns-palestinian-rights-official-condemns-both-sides-after-surprise-terror-attack/)

#### [UNâ€™s Palestinian rights official condemns both sides after surprise terror attack](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/uns-palestinian-rights-official-condemns-both-sides-after-surprise-terror-attack/)

By [Luke Tress](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/luke-tress/ "Luke Tress")

The UN Human Rights Council official tasked with investigating the Israeli-Palestinian conflict refrains from condemning Palestinian terrorists after they launch a devastating surprise attack on Israeli civilians and soldiers.

UN special rapporteur for the Palestinians Francesca Albanese says, â€œI unequivocally condemn attacks on civilians. Whoever launches them.â€

â€œTodayâ€™s violence must be put into context. Almost six decades of hostile military rule over an entire civilian populationâ€¦ are in themselves an aggression,â€ Albanese says. Israel withdrew from Gaza in 2005.

Albanese has a history of antisemitism and tends to place sole blame for the conflict on Israel, which she views as a â€œcolonialâ€ entity.

The US, Israel and other authorities have demanded her removal due to her bias, but the UN has not taken any action against her.

Martin Griffiths, UN under-secretary-general for humanitarian affairs, also hedges in his condemnation of terror.

â€œI am extremely alarmed by the rapidly escalating events in Israel and the occupied Palestinian territory. The number of civilian casualties on both sides is reportedly already in the hundreds,â€ he says. â€œViolence is never the answer. I appeal to all sides to stop the fighting immediately and protect civilians everywhere and at all times.â€

The UN high commissioner for human rights, Volker TÃ¼rk, condemns the terror attacks.

â€œI am shocked and appalled at reports this morning that hundreds, possibly thousands, of indiscriminate rockets have been fired by Palestinian armed groups towards Israel, and that at least 22 Israelis have been killed and hundreds injured,â€ TÃ¼rk says.

More recent figures indicate at least 200 Israelis have been killed, over 1,400 wounded, and others taken hostage.

UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres and Tor Wennesland, the UNâ€™s special coordinator for the Middle East peace process, both issue condemnations of the terror attacks.

[9:22 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/parents-search-for-children-who-attended-outdoor-party-attacked-by-terrorists/)

#### [Parents search for children who attended outdoor party attacked by terrorists](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/parents-search-for-children-who-attended-outdoor-party-attacked-by-terrorists/)

By [Jessica Steinberg](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/jessica-steinberg/ "Jessica Steinberg")

Hersh Goldberg-Polin, 23, hasnâ€™t been heard from since 8:11 a.m. this morning, when he sent two messages to his parents: â€œI love youâ€ and â€œIâ€™m sorry.â€

At the time, Goldberg-Polinâ€™s parents, Jon Polin and Rachel Goldberg, didnâ€™t understand the cryptic meaning of the message.

Theyâ€™d last seen Hersh at 11 p.m. the previous night, after he attended Simhat Torah holiday services with them at their local Jerusalem synagogue and then joined them for dinner with family friends.

â€œHe had a backpack and left at around 11 to join his friend,â€ said Polin, who didnâ€™t know anything specific about his sonâ€™s plans.

The family is religiously observant and doesnâ€™t usually use phones on Shabbat, but after Polin came home early from synagogue Saturday morning, the two reached out to a good friend of their sonâ€™s who confirmed that Goldberg-Polin was at an all-night â€œnature partyâ€ near Kibbutz Reâ€™im.

The community is close to the Gaza Strip, in an area where Hamas terrorists attacked civilians, including at the party.

Within several hours, photos of handwritten lists began circulating on social media with the names of party attendees and the locations where some had escaped to, Polin says.

â€œOne list said Yishuv Saad, and his name was on that list, and then it was on the Ofakim list,â€ Polin says. â€œBut he wasnâ€™t at any of those places.â€

Friends were at the coupleâ€™s home all day, calling and checking with people they knew in each location, but Goldberg-Polin and his friend havenâ€™t been found anywhere. They called hospitals in the south, including Soroka and Barzilay, without any success.

The Jerusalem police are involved, Polin says, and are taking responsibility for reporting the two missing young men to all police units. Pictures of Polin-Goldberg and his friend are also being circulated on social media.

â€œThey think thereâ€™s still a bunch of people hiding in the area,â€ Polin says, adding that the mother of his sonâ€™s friend is inclined to drive down south to look for them, but he advises against it, having heard that roads are closed. â€œEvery time we hear information, we turn over everything we can to find out anything. Thereâ€™s very little we can actually do.â€

[9:20 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/idf-says-it-struck-2-more-high-rise-towers-being-used-by-hamas-in-gaza/)

#### [IDF says it struck 2 more high-rise towers being used by Hamas in Gaza](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/idf-says-it-struck-2-more-high-rise-towers-being-used-by-hamas-in-gaza/)

By [Emanuel Fabian](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/emanuel-fabian/ "Emanuel Fabian")

[![Smoke billows from a residential building following an Israeli airstrike in Gaza City on October 7, 2023. The Israel Defense Forces says it struck another two high-rise towers in the Gaza Strip, used by Hamas.

The â€œPalestineâ€ building was used by a number of Hamas units, including intelligence, weapon production, and offices of senior members, the IDF says.

Another office building served as the headquarters of Hamasâ€™s general security, the IDF says.

Earlier today, the IDF hit two other multistory buildings in the Gaza Strip that the military says housed Hamas assets.

[9:12 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/hamas-deputy-anticipates-israeli-hostages-will-be-swapped-for-palestinian-prisoners/)

#### [Hamas deputy anticipates Israeli hostages will be swapped for Palestinian prisoners](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/hamas-deputy-anticipates-israeli-hostages-will-be-swapped-for-palestinian-prisoners/)

By [Gianluca Pacchiani](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/gianluca-pacchiani/ "Gianluca Pacchiani")

[![Hamas commander Saleh al-Arouri (YouTube screenshot)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2017/10/gesgvbe-640x400.jpg "Hamas commander Saleh al-Arouri (YouTube screenshot)")](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/hamas-deputy-anticipates-israeli-hostages-will-be-swapped-for-palestinian-prisoners/)

Hamas commander Saleh al-Arouri (YouTube screenshot)

In an interview with Al Jazeera, Saleh al-Arouri, deputy head of the political bureau of Hamas, calls the terror groupâ€™s onslaught against Israel an â€œopen battleâ€ aimed at achieving the liberation of the Palestinian people and their holy places, following the perceived â€œdesecrationâ€ of the Temple Mount in Jerusalem â€” known as the Al-Aqsa compound to Muslims â€” by Jewish worshipers over the holiday of Sukkot.

Al-Arouri alleges plans by Israel to impose an unspecified â€œnew realityâ€ at the flashpoint site after the holiday. Hamas has repeatedly accused Israel of seeking to alter the sensitive status quo at the holy site as a pretext for violence.

Al-Arouri adds that Palestinian detainees in Israeli jails are â€œabout to be freed,â€ anticipating the liberation of security prisoners in exchange for dozens of Israeli hostages the group has reportedly taken, including both civilians and soldiers.

Al-Arouri says some of the Israeli hostages are â€œsenior officers.â€ He falsely says Hamas does not kill or harm civilians, claiming that there are videos showing how the terror group treats civilians â€œhumanely.â€ Hamas terrorists slaughtered civilians in southern Israel today, took others captive, and fired hundreds of rockets at civilian population centers.

â€œWe have a plan for all stages of this conflict,â€ al-Arouri says, â€œboth in case of an Israeli request for a ceasefire, and in case of a continuing escalation of the violence. We are prepared for all options.â€ He adds that an Israeli ground invasion would be the â€œbest scenarioâ€ for Hamas.

Al-Arouri also expresses his â€œhope and trustâ€ that Palestinians outside Gaza will join the fight â€œto defend Al-Aqsa,â€ especially terror groups in the West Bank. Al-Arouri is considered the de facto leader of Hamas in the West Bank.

â€œWe entered this battle not just for a few hours. We entered it knowing that there will be consequences, and we have no choice but to fight it to achieve our high goals,â€ he says.

He adds that Hamas is in communication with international and regional parties, and implies that it has received offers for mediation. He also accuses the US of providing financial and military aid to Ukraine but neglecting Palestinians.

Al-Arouri touches on the possible participation of Hezbollah in the attack on Israel, saying Israel is right to fear violence on the Lebanese front in the north, claiming that Israel occupies part of Lebanonâ€™s territory.

[9:07 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/netanyahu-offers-lapid-gantz-to-join-him-in-emergency-unity-government/)

#### [Netanyahu offers Lapid, Gantz to join him in emergency unity government](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/netanyahu-offers-lapid-gantz-to-join-him-in-emergency-unity-government/)

By [Jeremy Sharon](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/jeremy-sharon/ "Jeremy Sharon")

[![Yair Lapid (L), Benny Gantz (C) and Benjamin Netanyahu (R) (Flash90)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2022/10/FotoJet-80-e1666087451710-640x400.jpg "Yair Lapid (L), Benny Gantz (C) and Benjamin Netanyahu (R) (Flash90)")](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/netanyahu-offers-lapid-gantz-to-join-him-in-emergency-unity-government/)

Yair Lapid (L), Benny Gantz (C) and Benjamin Netanyahu (R) (Flash90)

Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu proposes that opposition parties Yesh Atid and National Unity enter an emergency government following Hamasâ€™s devastating surprise attack Saturday morning.

Netanyahu makes the offer during a meeting with Yesh Atid leader Yair Lapid and National Unity party leader Benny Gantz held earlier today, saying such a government would be the same in format as the Levi Eshkol government then-opposition leader Menachem Begin joined before the Six Day War in 1967.

Gantz says he is considering entering such a government for the duration of the war but insists that government would â€œdeal with security challenges aloneâ€ and in a manner that would allow â€œsubstantive partnership and influence over decision-making in relevant forumsâ€ for his party.

The National Unity party leader tells Netanyahu that regardless, the current government will receive full backing â€œfor any responsible and determined security action.â€

Lapid said earlier this evening that he would join â€œa reduced, professional, emergency governmentâ€ and says it would be impossible to manage a war with â€œthe extreme and dysfunctional composition of the current cabinet,â€ essentially calling on the prime minister to remove the far-right Religious Zionism and Otzma Yehudit parties from the government in order for him to bring his Yesh Atid party into the coalition.

[9:03 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/hamas-run-health-ministry-says-232-killed-in-gaza-since-start-of-terror-group-assault-on-israel/)

[8:54 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/israeli-death-toll-from-devastating-hamas-attack-rises-to-more-than-200/)

#### [Israeli death toll from devastating Hamas attack rises to more than 200](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/israeli-death-toll-from-devastating-hamas-attack-rises-to-more-than-200/)

[![Israeli rescue teams evacuate a wounded person near the southern city of Sderot on October 7, 2023, after the Palestinian terror group Hamas launched a large-scale surprise attack on Israel. Israeli rescue teams evacuate a wounded person near the southern city of Sderot on October 7, 2023, after the Palestinian terror group Hamas launched a large-scale surprise attack on Israel. (Menahem KAHANA / AFP)

The death toll from the Hamas terror groupâ€™s massive attack on Israel rises to more than 200, Hebrew-language media reports say.

The toll is expected to rise higher.

At least 1,100 have been wounded, many seriously.

Hundreds of Hamas gunmen infiltrated into Israel this morning, crossing at multiple points and overwhelming what the IDF considered to be the highly sophisticated border fence.

Hamas claims to have abducted dozens of Israelis to Gaza; the IDF has confirmed that soldiers and civilians have been taken hostage, but has not specified a number.

Thousands of rockets have been fired at the south and center of the country, killing a number of people.

[8:40 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/9-wounded-in-rishon-lezion-tel-aviv-bat-yam-and-yavne-during-rocket-barrage/)

#### [9 wounded in Rishon Lezion, Tel Aviv, Bat Yam and Yavne during rocket barrage](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/9-wounded-in-rishon-lezion-tel-aviv-bat-yam-and-yavne-during-rocket-barrage/)

By [Emanuel Fabian](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/emanuel-fabian/ "Emanuel Fabian")

[![Salvo of rockets fired by Palestinian terrorists from Gaza City toward Israel on October 7, 2023 (EYAD BABA / AFP)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2023/10/33XP9AR-highres-640x400.jpg "Salvo of rockets fired by Palestinian terrorists from Gaza City toward Israel on October 7, 2023 (EYAD BABA / AFP)")](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/9-wounded-in-rishon-lezion-tel-aviv-bat-yam-and-yavne-during-rocket-barrage/)

Salvo of rockets fired by Palestinian terrorists from Gaza City toward Israel on October 7, 2023 (EYAD BABA / AFP)

The Hamas rocket barrage on central Israel a short while ago has wounded at least nine civilians, medics say.

The Magen David Adom ambulance service said in Rishon Lezion, medics treated two men aged 28 who were seriously hurt.

In Yavne, a 73-year-old woman was seriously hurt and a 77-year-old man was lightly hurt, MDA says.

In Bat Yam, a 24-year-old man was moderately hurt, MDA says.

In Tel Aviv, four people were wounded, including one in moderate condition, MDA adds.

The victims are being taken to hospitals in the area.

Hamas claimed to have launched 150 rockets from the Gaza Strip at Tel Aviv in the barrage.

[7:50 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/thousands-of-units-of-blood-donated-mda-says-drive-paused/)

#### [Thousands of units of blood donated; MDA says drive paused](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/thousands-of-units-of-blood-donated-mda-says-drive-paused/)

By [Renee Ghert-Zand](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/renee-ghert-zand/ "Renee Ghert-Zand")

[![Hundreds in line at the Ichilov hospital in Tel Aviv to donate blood, October 7, 2023 (Tomer Neuberg/Flash90)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2023/10/F231007TN37-640x400.jpg "Hundreds in line at the Ichilov hospital in Tel Aviv to donate blood, October 7, 2023 (Tomer Neuberg/Flash90)")](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/thousands-of-units-of-blood-donated-mda-says-drive-paused/)

Hundreds in line at the Ichilov hospital in Tel Aviv to donate blood, October 7, 2023 (Tomer Neuberg/Flash90)

Magen David Adom thanks the Israeli public for its huge response to the call for blood donations for treating war victims at Israelâ€™s hospitals. Thousands of units of blood were donated at the many MDA donation sites around the country.

As of 7:30 p.m. on Saturday, MDA says it has enough blood supply for the time being and has asked people to hold off on donating until tomorrow or later in the week.

At Ichilov Hospital in Tel Aviv alone, 650 individuals showed up to donate blood. Overwhelmed by the turnout, Ichilov announced that it had closed its blood donation station until further notice.

For information on where to donate blood around the country, check the [MDA website.](https://www.mdais.org/blood-donation)

[7:48 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/idf-regains-control-of-reim-military-base-from-hamas-terrorists-in-southern-israel/)

#### [IDF regains control of Reâ€™im military base from Hamas terrorists in southern Israel](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/idf-regains-control-of-reim-military-base-from-hamas-terrorists-in-southern-israel/)

By [Emanuel Fabian](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/emanuel-fabian/ "Emanuel Fabian")

The Israel Defense Forces has regained control of the Reâ€™im military base in southern Israel, which houses the Gaza Division, from Hamas terrorists, according to Hebrew-language media reports.

Earlier, the IDF said it was fighting Hamas terrorists at 22 different locations in southern Israel.

The military has been sweeping the towns where the terrorists infiltrated, reaching civilians who have been holed up for more than 12 hours.

â€œIt is now time for the international community including the Security Council to unequivocally condemn the appalling terror attacks carried out by Hamas and all terrorist organizations against the civilians of Israel,â€ Erdan writes.

[7:41 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/us-defense-chief-austin-speaks-with-gallant-reaffirms-pentagon-commitment-to-israels-security/)

[7:35 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/idf-says-troops-have-killed-hundreds-of-terrorists/)

#### [IDF says troops have killed hundreds of terrorists](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/idf-says-troops-have-killed-hundreds-of-terrorists/)

By [Emanuel Fabian](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/emanuel-fabian/ "Emanuel Fabian")

[![Screenshot from footage released by IDF showing strikes on terrorists near Gaza, on October 7, 2023. (Screenshot/IDF)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2023/10/Untitled-1-3-640x400.jpg "Screenshot from footage released by IDF showing strikes on terrorists near Gaza, on October 7, 2023. (Screenshot/IDF)")](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/idf-says-troops-have-killed-hundreds-of-terrorists/)

Screenshot from footage released by IDF showing strikes on terrorists near Gaza, on October 7, 2023. (Screenshot/IDF)

The Israel Defense Forces claims to have killed hundreds of Palestinian terrorists in southern Israel and the Gaza Strip in the last few hours.

Among the counter-attacks is a drone strike against two terrorists attempting to breach the security barrier near the disused Karni crossing; nine terrorists killed during clashes with troops in the town of Nirim; and four terrorists targeted by a fighter jet at the Erez Crossing.

Other terror squads were killed by troops in the southern towns of Sufa, Kfar Aza, and Kerem Shalom, the IDF says.

The IDF also carried out several drone strikes against terrorists in the area.

The military publishes footage showing one of the strikes near the southern town of Beâ€™eri.

[7:33 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/4-hamas-terrorists-holding-two-israelis-hostage-for-hours-in-ofakim-apartment/)

#### [4 Hamas terrorists holding two Israelis hostage for hours in Ofakim apartment](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/4-hamas-terrorists-holding-two-israelis-hostage-for-hours-in-ofakim-apartment/)

Four terrorists are still holding two Israelis hostage in an apartment in Ofakim, some 12 miles (20 kilometers) from the Gaza border.

The incident has been playing out all day, since several carloads of terrorists drove into the city, Channel 12 reports.

When rocket alarms sounded, and residents of the city descended into bomb shelters, the gunmen opened fire on them, killing several people. Many terrorists have been killed in the hours since.

Four terrorists went up into an apartment in the city, where two Israelis remained, and they have been holding them hostage ever since.

Security forces have made several attempts to find a way to break in and rescue them, but to no avail thus far.

Magen David Adomâ€™s Shai Kadosh says two people he knows were killed in the city during the day and that he and his colleagues have been treating casualties all day.

#### [Hamas claims to be holding dozens of Israeli soldiers, officers in Gaza Strip](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/hamas-claims-to-be-holding-dozens-of-israeli-soldiers-officers-in-gaza-strip/)

[![Palestinians drive a captured Israeli military vehicle in Gaza City on Oct. 7, 2023. [7:31 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/health-ministry-says-all-elective-medical-services-cancelled-in-south-center-on-sunday/)

#### [Health Ministry says all elective medical services cancelled in south, center hospitals on Sunday](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/health-ministry-says-all-elective-medical-services-cancelled-in-south-center-on-sunday/)

By [Renee Ghert-Zand](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/renee-ghert-zand/ "Renee Ghert-Zand")

In light of the high number of injuries due to the war, the Health Ministry announces that all ambulatory and elective medical services will be canceled on Sunday at hospitals within 80 km of the Gaza border. Well-baby clinics will also be closed within that area.

Some hospitals in the center of the country, including Hadassah in Jerusalem and Meir in Kfar Saba, have also announced that they will only accept patients in need of urgent medical care.

Hospitals throughout the country will continue to provide critical and timely care, such as oncological and hematological treatments, dialysis, in vitro fertilization treatment, and emergency cardiological procedures.

If patients are scheduled for a hospital procedure or clinic visit on Monday, they should double-check with the hospital whether they should come in or not.

The Meuhedet health maintenance organization has asked its members to seek service from their primary physicians via hybrid (online) medicine appointments as much as possible.

All medical system employees have been ordered to cancel plans to travel outside the country, and all medical staff currently outside Israel have been asked to return.

[6:52 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/israeli-activists-in-us-raise-funds-coordinate-hosts-for-canceled-flights/)

#### [Israeli activists in US raise funds, coordinate hosts for canceled flights](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/israeli-activists-in-us-raise-funds-coordinate-hosts-for-canceled-flights/)

By [Luke Tress](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/luke-tress/ "Luke Tress")

Israeli activists in the US launch a crowdfunding campaign to assist residents of southern Israel.

The activists from the anti-overhaul protest movement leverage their network of thousands of Israelis and US Jews in the US to respond to the Palestinian terror onslaught in Israel.

The funds will go to medical, psychological and physical support for the victims, [the campaign](https://www.americaisraeldemocracy.org/southunderattack)
 says.

â€œWe join hands to support the needs of Israelis under attack. This is what we can do from here now,â€ organizers say. â€œThis is exactly the same solidarity from which we stand in rallies every week.â€

All protest activities are suspended.

With some flights to Israel canceled, the activists are also organizing local hosts who can house Israelis who are unable to return home.

Activists from the UnXeptable protest group urge Israelis who are in the US and need assistance to contact them.

An open support gathering will take place at the Jewish Community Center of Manhattan at 76th Street and Amsterdam Ave. between 2-4 p.m. this afternoon.

The Israeli consulate in New York also says it is accepting all offers of help and support.

â€œThe State of Israel is at war. It wonâ€™t be easy and it wonâ€™t be short. It has strategic consequences which we havenâ€™t seen for many years. There is a serious risk that it will become a multi-front war,â€ Lapid says in an announcement.

â€œA short while ago, I met with Prime Minister Netanyahu. I told him that in this emergency situation Iâ€™m willing to put aside our differences and form an emergency, narrow, professional government with him to manage the difficult and complex operation ahead of us.â€

â€œForming an emergency professional government will make clear to our enemies that the vast majority of Israeli citizens stand behind the IDF and security forces. â€œThe State of Israel suffered a hard blow today. We are all hurting, we are all angry. However, wars and countries arenâ€™t managed with pain and anger but with calm and a strategic understanding of the situation. We need to put politics to one side for the sake of an emergency government that will manage this situation with determination and wonâ€™t deal with anything else until we achieve victory over our enemies.â€

Lapid made his offer for an emergency government in person to Netanyahu after receiving a security update, says a source close to the opposition leader.

The source says that â€œthe offer is real, this isnâ€™t a political thing. The offer is there.â€

Netanyahu has not responded and a source close to Lapid declines to comment if fellow opposition party head, National Unity leader Gantz, was consulted before or after the unity government offer was made.

[6:11 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/un-chief-appalled-by-attacks-abductions-of-israelis-by-hamas-in-massive-assault/)

#### [UN chief â€˜appalledâ€™ by attacks, abductions of Israelis by Hamas in massive assault](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/un-chief-appalled-by-attacks-abductions-of-israelis-by-hamas-in-massive-assault/)

â€œThe secretary-general is appalled by reports that civilians have been attacked and abducted from their own homes,â€ says a statement from his spokesperson.

Guterres â€œis deeply concerned for the civilian population and urges maximum restraint. Civilians must be respected and protected in accordance with international humanitarian law at all times.â€

â€œThe secretary-general urges all diplomatic efforts to avoid a wider conflagration,â€ the statement continues. â€œHe stresses that violence cannot provide a solution to the conflict, and that only through negotiation leading to a two-state solution can peace be achieved.â€

[6:11 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/israeli-tv-shows-pixelated-videos-of-israelis-being-taken-as-hostages-to-gaza-by-hamas/)

#### [Israeli TV shows pixelated videos of Israelis being taken as hostages to Gaza by Hamas](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/israeli-tv-shows-pixelated-videos-of-israelis-being-taken-as-hostages-to-gaza-by-hamas/)

[![Israelis being kidnapped and taken into Gaza by Hamas terrorists, October 7, 2023, as seen in pixelated videos from social media screened on Israeli television. Now that the IDF has confirmed that Israeli civilians and soldiers have been kidnapped and taken as hostages to Gaza, Israeli television is showing heavily pixelated clips that have been running for hours on social media.

Many of the clips are too gruesome to broadcast.

[6:09 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/senior-firefighters-among-100-killed-in-hamas-attacks-on-israel/)

#### [Senior firefighters among 100 killed in Hamas attacks on Israel](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/senior-firefighters-among-100-killed-in-hamas-attacks-on-israel/)

By [Emanuel Fabian](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/emanuel-fabian/ "Emanuel Fabian")

[![The Israel Fire and Rescue Services say the head of the Kiryat Gat station, Cpt. Shalom Tzaban, and a senior firefighter from the Netivot station, Yevgeny Galsky, were among those killed in the Hamas terrorist attack on southern Israel October 7, 2023. (Courtesy)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2023/10/WhatsApp-Image-2023-10-07-at-18.00.00-e1696691314639-640x400.jpeg "The Israel Fire and Rescue Services say the head of the Kiryat Gat station, Cpt. (Courtesy)")](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/senior-firefighters-among-100-killed-in-hamas-attacks-on-israel/)

The Israel Fire and Rescue Services say the head of the Kiryat Gat station, Cpt. Shalom Tzaban, and a senior firefighter from the Netivot station, Yevgeny Galsky, were among those killed in the Hamas terrorist attack on southern Israel October 7, 2023. (Courtesy)

The Israel Fire and Rescue Services say the head of the Kiryat Gat station, Cpt. Shalom Tzaban, and a senior firefighter from the Netivot station, Yevgeny Galsky, were among those killed in the Hamas terrorist attack on southern Israel today.

Tzaban, 60, a father of two, was drafted into the fire service in 1992. He is posthumously promoted to the rank of Deputy Fire Chief.

Galsky, 34, joined the force three years ago. He is posthumously promoted to the rank of Sergeant Firefighter.

[5:40 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/hamas-never-dreamed-of-such-success-like-9-11-for-israel-says-mideast-analyst/)

#### [Hamas never dreamed of such success, like 9/11 for Israel, says Mideast analyst](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/hamas-never-dreamed-of-such-success-like-9-11-for-israel-says-mideast-analyst/)

By [Amanda Borschel-Dan](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/amanda-borschel-dan/ "Amanda Borschel-Dan")

Middle East analyst Avi Issacharoff tells The Times of Israel on Saturday that the unprecedented assault on Israel by land, sea and air is an inadvertent benchmark for the Israel-Hamas relations, as significant as the September 11, 2001 attacks on the US.

â€œI think that they wanted to kidnap a few people, to negotiate over them, and not to get into the threat of their collapse â€” of their endingâ€ â€” that this coordinated attack will inevitably bring, Issacharoff says. â€œEveryone knows that Gaza will pay a very heavy price.â€

Any former policies of cooperation with the Gaza-based terrorist organization are â€œnot even relevant anymore,â€ he says, and negotiations â€œunder or over the tableâ€ will no longer take place.

Asked whether he believes Israelâ€™s northern border will become another front in the current war, he says it is as yet unclear whether Hezbollah is planning a coordinated attack.

â€œEither theyâ€™re going to jump in and be very stupid, or not,â€ he says.

â€œStarting another front with Israel may bring more \[Israeli\] casualtiesâ€¦ but at the end of the day, we might end up with the end of Hamas and Hezbollah.â€

â€œItâ€™s the 9/11 \[for Israel\], and if this doesnâ€™t go into a major ground operation, itâ€™s the end of this governmentâ€™s political life,â€ says Issacharoff.

Four divisions are being deployed to the Gaza border, joining 31 battalions that are already there, Hagari says.

[4:22 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/raam-leader-abbas-urges-arab-community-not-to-respond-to-incitement-calls-for-unity/)

#### [Raâ€™am leader Abbas urges Arab community not to respond to incitement, calls for unity](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/raam-leader-abbas-urges-arab-community-not-to-respond-to-incitement-calls-for-unity/)

By [Gianluca Pacchiani](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/gianluca-pacchiani/ "Gianluca Pacchiani")

[![Ra'am party head MK Mansour Abbas leads a faction meeting, at the Knesset in Jerusalem, on June 12, 2023. (Yonatan Sindel/Flash90)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2023/07/F230612YS125-1-640x400.jpg "Ra'am party head MK Mansour Abbas leads a faction meeting, at the Knesset in Jerusalem, on June 12, 2023. (Yonatan Sindel/Flash90)")](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/raam-leader-abbas-urges-arab-community-not-to-respond-to-incitement-calls-for-unity/)

Ra'am party head MK Mansour Abbas leads a faction meeting, at the Knesset in Jerusalem, on June 12, 2023. (Yonatan Sindel/Flash90)

Raâ€™amâ€™s Mansour Abbas urges Arab Israelis not to respond to rumors or incitement

Abbas, leader of the Islamist Raâ€™am party, is the first Arab Israeli political leader to publish a statement reacting to the ongoing deadly Hamas assault on Israel.

The party leader writes in Hebrew: â€œIn light of the sad, tragic events since this morning, and the situation assessments saying that the situation may devolve into a regional war, I call on Arab citizens of Israel and on all citizens, Arabs and Jews alike, to exert restraint and behave responsibly and patiently, to obey the law and maintain public order.â€

â€œI urge \[Arab Israeli citizens\] to restrain from any type of violence or damage to public or private property, and not respond to rumors or incitement aimed at causing an escalation inside or outside Arab towns, or in mixed cities.â€

Abbas further calls for unity and mutual support and to give hospitality to families fleeing the areas under attack, particularly in the Negev and in unrecognized villages, many of which are not equipped with anti-rocket shelters.

[3:04 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/at-least-40-killed-over-700-injured-since-start-of-devastating-hamas-attack/)

#### [At least 40 killed, over 700 injured in devastating Hamas attack](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/at-least-40-killed-over-700-injured-since-start-of-devastating-hamas-attack/)

[![Wounded Israeli soldiers from the south arrive at the Hadassah Ein Kerem Hospital in Jerusalem, October 7, 2023. (Noam Revkin Fenton/Flash90)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2023/10/F231007NRF49-640x400.jpg "Wounded Israeli soldiers from the south arrive at the Hadassah Ein Kerem Hospital in Jerusalem, October 7, 2023. Wounded Israeli soldiers from the south arrive at the Hadassah Ein Kerem Hospital in Jerusalem, October 7, 2023. (Noam Revkin Fenton/Flash90)

At least 40 people have been killed and over 700 injured since the start of the massive attack by the Hamas terror group, the Magen David Adom emergency service says.

The Health Ministry says 779 people have been hospitalized.

Terror cells from the Gaza group have infiltrated a number of communities in the south of the country.

In addition, thousands of rockets have been fired at the center and south.

Hamas has claimed to have taken a number of hostages from Israel to the Gaza Strip. There has been no confirmation from Israel.

The assault has been ongoing since approximately 6:30 a.m.

The death toll is expected to rise.

[2:53 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/netanyahu-calls-on-citizens-to-unite-and-achieve-victory-in-war-amid-hamas-assault/)

#### [Netanyahu calls on citizens to unite and achieve victory in war amid Hamas assault](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/netanyahu-calls-on-citizens-to-unite-and-achieve-victory-in-war-amid-hamas-assault/)

[![Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu leads a security cabinet meeting in Tel Aviv, October 7, 2023. (Haim Zach/GPO)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2023/10/WhatsApp-Image-2023-10-07-at-14.43.21-640x400.jpeg "Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu leads a security cabinet meeting in Tel Aviv, October 7, 2023. (Haim Zach/GPO)")](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/netanyahu-calls-on-citizens-to-unite-and-achieve-victory-in-war-amid-hamas-assault/)

Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu leads a security cabinet meeting in Tel Aviv, October 7, 2023. (Haim Zach/GPO)

Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu makes a statement at the start of the security cabinet meeting, calling for all the citizens of the country to unite.

â€œSince this morning, the State of Israel has been at war. Our first goal is first of all to cleanse the area of the enemy forces that have infiltrated, and restore security and peace to the settlements that were attacked,â€ Netanyahu says.

â€œThe second goal, at the same time, is to exact a huge price from the enemy, also in the Gaza Strip,â€ he says.

â€œThe third goal is to fortify other arenas so that no one makes the mistake of joining this war,â€ Netanyahu says.

â€œWe are at war, in war, you have to keep calm. I call on all citizens of Israel to unite in order to achieve our highest goal â€“ victory in the war,â€ the premier says.

The official name for the campaign by the Israel Defense Forces amid the devastating Hamas attack is Operation Swords of Iron.

â€œHorrible news from Israel. My condolences go out to everyone who lost relatives or close ones in the terrorist attack. We have faith that order will be restored and terrorists will be defeated.

â€œTerror should have no place in the world, because it is always a crime, not just against a specific country or this terrorâ€™s victims, but against humanity in general and our entire world.

â€œAnyone who resorts to terror commits a crime against the world. Whoever finances terror is committing a crime against the world. The world must stand united and in solidarity so that terror does not attempt to break or subjugate life anywhere and at any moment.

â€œAll Ukrainian citizens who remain in the risk zone must carefully obey all orders issued by local security services and remain vigilant. Please be cautious. The Ukrainian Ministry of Foreign Affairs and our embassy in Israel are ready to assist in any situation.

â€œTo support Ukrainians in Israel, we established an operational headquarters. If you require assistance, please contact any of our diplomatic or consular offices in any convenient and accessible manner.

Every life is valuable! We condemn all forms of terrorism.â€

[12:12 pm](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/idf-home-front-cancels-school-in-south-center-of-country-on-sunday/)

#### [IDF Home Front cancels school in south, center of country on Sunday](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/idf-home-front-cancels-school-in-south-center-of-country-on-sunday/)

By [Emanuel Fabian](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/emanuel-fabian/ "Emanuel Fabian")

[![Residents take shelter in the basement of a building following a rocket attack from the Gaza Strip into Israel on October 7, 2023 (JACK GUEZ / AFP)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2023/10/33XN7BG-highres-e1696665071534-640x400.jpg "Residents take shelter in the basement of a building following a rocket attack from the Gaza Strip into Israel on October 7, 2023 (JACK GUEZ / AFP)")](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/idf-home-front-cancels-school-in-south-center-of-country-on-sunday/)

Residents take shelter in the basement of a building following a rocket attack from the Gaza Strip into Israel on October 7, 2023 (JACK GUEZ / AFP)

The Israel Defense Forces announces it is canceling schools in central and southern Israel, meaning roughly 1 million children will stay home tomorrow, amid ongoing fighting between Israel and terror groups in the Gaza Strip.

All schools south of Netanya and north of the central Negev are to be closed and businesses can only be opened if there is ready access to bomb shelters, the military says.

Gatherings are also restricted to 10 people outdoors and 50 people indoors in those areas, the IDF Home Front Command says.

The restrictions are valid till Sunday at 6 p.m., but will likely be extended further amid the fighting.

[11:59 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/idf-country-in-state-of-war-hamas-terrorists-still-in-israel/)

#### [IDF: Country in state of war, Hamas terrorists still in Israel](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/idf-country-in-state-of-war-hamas-terrorists-still-in-israel/)

By [Emanuel Fabian](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/emanuel-fabian/ "Emanuel Fabian")

[![Palestinian terrorists take control of an Israeli tank after crossing the border fence with Israel from Khan Younis in the southern Gaza Strip on October 7, 2023. (SAID KHATIB / AFP)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2023/10/33XP69D-highres-640x400.jpg "Palestinian terrorists take control of an Israeli tank after crossing the border fence with Israel from Khan Younis in the southern Gaza Strip on October 7, 2023. (SAID KHATIB / AFP)")](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/idf-country-in-state-of-war-hamas-terrorists-still-in-israel/)

Palestinian terrorists take control of an Israeli tank after crossing the border fence with Israel from Khan Younis in the southern Gaza Strip on October 7, 2023. (SAID KHATIB / AFP)

The Israel Defense Forcesâ€™ top spokesman, Rear Adm. Daniel Hagari, says Israel is â€œin a state of warâ€ following Hamasâ€™s surprise attack.

â€œThe IDF has declared a state of war. We are in a state of war,â€ Hagari says in a live video statement.

â€œMore than 2,000 rockets have been fired. Terrorists infiltrated, and some are still in Israel,â€ he says.

â€œThe IDF is flooding the area with troops. We are focusing on the fighting on the Gaza border,â€ Hagari continues.

â€œWe have begun a widespread call-up in all parts of the IDF. The Air Force is also striking in Gaza,â€ he adds.

#### [Some East Jerusalem mosques call for residents to join Hamas assault](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/some-east-jerusalem-mosques-call-for-residents-to-join-hamas-assault/)

By [Gianluca Pacchiani](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/gianluca-pacchiani/ "Gianluca Pacchiani")

Mosques in Shuafat refugee camp in Jerusalem call to join the fight.

Pro-Hamas channels share a clip showing mosques of the Shuafat refugee camp inside the Jerusalem municipality, issuing from their minarets calls for people to mobilize.

Gunfire can also be heard in the background.

The channels also share videos of street celebrations in the West Bank city of Nablus.

[10:07 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/hospitals-say-more-than-100-israelis-wounded-in-rocket-barrage-several-seriously/)

#### [Hospitals say more than 100 Israelis wounded in rocket barrage, several seriously](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/hospitals-say-more-than-100-israelis-wounded-in-rocket-barrage-several-seriously/)

[![The scene after a rocket fired from Gaza hit a building in North Tel Aviv on October 7, 2023 (Tomer Neyberg/Flash90)](https://static.timesofisrael.com/www/uploads/2023/10/F231007TN01-1-640x400.jpg "The scene after a rocket fired from Gaza hit a building in North Tel Aviv on October 7, 2023 (Tomer Neyberg/Flash90)")](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/hospitals-say-more-than-100-israelis-wounded-in-rocket-barrage-several-seriously/)

The scene after a rocket fired from Gaza hit a building in North Tel Aviv on October 7, 2023 (Tomer Neyberg/Flash90)

Hospitals say more than 100 Israelis have been wounded in rocket strikes across south and central Israel, some in critical condition.

Soraka Hospital in Beersheba says it has received 80 patients, some of them in a very serious condition.

The Assaf Harofeh Medical Center near Tel Aviv says it is treating 17 patients, two in serious condition and one in moderate condition. the rest are lightly wounded.

The Kaplan Medical Center in Rehovot is treating 21 casualties including two in a serious condition who are being operated on.

Four are moderately wounded and 15 lightly.

Not all hospitals have reported their patients.

[10:04 am](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog_entry/rocket-fired-from-gaza-hits-road-in-town-near-jerusalem/)

By [Emanuel Fabian](https://www.timesofisrael.com/writers/emanuel-fabian/ "Emanuel Fabian")

Police say a rocket launched from the Gaza Strip landed on a road in a town near Jerusalem.

The rocket impact causes damage in Mevaseret Zion, but no injuries.

The Israel Defense Forces shutters roads near the border with the Gaza Strip amid Hamasâ€™s surprise attack.

All routes used by farmers in the area as also closed off by the army.

The Zikim beach on the Gaza border is also closed off, and trains will not run between Ashkelon and Sderot, the IDF says.

Other videos showed a crowd of Palestinian men dancing around and atop an Israeli tank that was on fire.

The authenticity of the videos could not immediately be verified.

SummarizeResultPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
In order to find evidence that helps your fact-check, you just ran a web search which yielded a Search Result. **Your task right now is to summarize the Search Result.** What to include:
* information that might be useful for the fact-check (see Record)
* relevant images (refer to images by inserting their reference <image:k>)
* if available: the release date as well as the author or the publisher (e.g. the media company) of the search result.

Do NOT include:
* advertisements
* any other information not related to the Record or the Claim

Additional rules:
* Do not add any additional information besides the information in the Search Result.
* If the Search Result doesn't contain any relevant information for the fact-checking work, simply print one word in capital letters: "NONE".
* Keep your writing style like in the Examples 1, 2 and 3 provided to you.
* Try to filter out relevant information even if the search result is in a different language.

# Example 1
The search result from America Today provides several photographs of the Notre-Dame Cathedral fire on April 15, 2019. <image:i>, <image:j>, <image:k>. None of the images show the Eiffel Tower in the background. 

# Example 2
NONE

# Example 3
The Guardian discusses a report blaming the Syrian government for a toxic gas attack and condemning their use of chemical weapons. The Guardian mentions the Chemical Weapons Convention and the responsibilities of Syria under the convention. According to The Guardian, The White House condemned the Assad regime for defying the norm against chemical weapons use.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:58> This image shows the aftermath of a Houthi attack on Tel Aviv, Israel, in July 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:58>)
geolocate(<image:58>)
web_search("Houthi attack Tel Aviv July 2024")
```

In a statement, the Iran-backed group said it had fired missiles at the Nirit area in the Israeli capital. In a Telegram post, the Lebanese group said they carried out the recent attack in solidarity with Palestinians in Gaza and in support of protecting the Lebanese people. Hezbollahâ€™s statement came after a video verified by Al Jazeeraâ€™s Sanad agency.

According to a Reuters report, sirens sounded all around Tel Aviv during the airstrike. No casualties have been reported in the attack so far. The Israeli military confirmed that Hezbollah fired at least 20 rockets toward Tel Aviv.

Hezbollah and Israel have been engaged in a fierce military conflict since the Palestinian militant group Hamas launched a massive attack on Israel on October 7, 2023.

Yemeni [Houthi](/wiki/Houthi_movement "Houthi movement")
 militants performed a drone attack on Israel on 19 July 2024, hitting an apartment building near the [US Embassy branch office](/wiki/Tel_Aviv_Branch_Office_of_the_Embassy_of_the_United_States "Tel Aviv Branch Office of the Embassy of the United States")
 in [Tel Aviv](/wiki/Tel_Aviv "Tel Aviv")
, Israel's economic center[\[2\]](#cite_note-:0-2)
 in [Ben Yehuda Street](/wiki/Ben_Yehuda_Street_(Tel_Aviv) "Ben Yehuda Street (Tel Aviv)")
.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)
 The drone strike killed one person in his apartment building, and injured 10 others.[\[1\]](#cite_note-toll-1)
[\[4\]](#cite_note-:1-4)
 The drone was spotted but not intercepted due to what Israel attributed to human error, with the Houthis asserting that they had developed a drone with the ability to evade the [Iron Dome](/wiki/Iron_Dome "Iron Dome")
. [Archived](https://archive.today/20240721014048/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2024/7/19/houthi-drone-strikes-tel-aviv-how-significant-is-the-attack)
     from the original on 21 July 2024. Retrieved 27 July 2024.

Retrieved from "[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2024\_Houthi\_drone\_attack\_on\_Israel&oldid=1298339889](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2024_Houthi_drone_attack_on_Israel&oldid=1298339889)
"

# Search Result
From [Source](https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/israeli-military-says-tel-aviv-blast-apparently-caused-by-drone-2024-07-19/): 
Content: "[Skip to main content](#main-content)

[Exclusive news, data and analytics for financial market professionalsLearn more aboutRefinitiv](/differentiator/)

TEL AVIV, July 19 (Reuters) - A long-range Iranian-made drone hit the centre of Tel Aviv in the early hours of Friday in an attack claimed by the Yemen-based [Houthi](/world/middle-east/who-are-yemens-houthis-why-are-they-under-attack-2024-01-12/)
 militia that killed one man and wounded four others, the Israeli military and emergency services said.

The explosion, which footage shared on social media suggested came from the sea and did not trigger air raid alarms, occurred hours after the Israeli military [confirmed](/world/middle-east/commander-hezbollahs-radwan-forces-killed-israeli-strike-south-lebanon-two-2024-07-18/)
 it had killed a senior commander of the Iran-backed Hezbollah militia in southern Lebanon.

Sign up [here.](undefined?location=article-paragraph&redirectUrl=%2Fworld%2Fmiddle-east%2Fisraeli-military-says-tel-aviv-blast-apparently-caused-by-drone-2024-07-19%2F)

Chief spokesperson Rear Admiral Daniel Hagari said the military assessed that the drone, which hit a building near the beachfront close to U.S. Embassy premises in Tel Aviv, was an upgraded Iranian-made Samad-3 model.

"Our estimation is that it arrived from Yemen to Tel Aviv," he told a press briefing.

A spokesman for the Houthis, which like Hezbollah are aligned with Iran, said the group had attacked Tel Aviv with a drone and would continue to target Israel in solidarity with Palestinians in the Gaza war.

The attack, which took place ahead of a visit to Washington by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu next week, is likely to fan fears about further fallout from the Gaza war as the Houthis and other Iranian proxies side with the Palestinian militant group Hamas.

Defence Minister Yoav Gallant met military commanders to review air defences and said the country had to be ready for all scenarios. "We must be prepared for defensive and offensive actions," he said, according to a statement from his office.

An Israeli official said the military was still investigating why the drone did not trigger the alarm, but initial reports suggested the aircraft was identified but the sirens were not sounded due to human error.

"We're talking about a large UAV (Unmanned Aerial Vehicle) that can fly large distances," the military official told journalists after the strike.

!Explosion amid the Israel-Hamas conflict in Tel Aviv <image:131>

Item 1 of 12 A man looks at a building damaged at the site of an explosion, amid the Israel-Hamas conflict in Tel Aviv, Israel July 19, 2024. REUTERS/Ricardo Moraes

**\[1/12\]**A man looks at a building damaged at the site of an explosion, amid the Israel-Hamas conflict in Tel Aviv, Israel July 19, 2024. The mayor of Tel Aviv said the city, Israel's economic centre, had been moved to a state of heightened alert.

In the hours following Friday's attack, sirens sounded repeatedly in areas close to the border with Lebanon and Israeli air defences intercepted at least one aerial target that crossed into Israel.

"OPERATION ACHIEVED ITS GOALS"
------------------------------

Houthi spokesperson Yahya Saree called Tel Aviv a primary target "within the range of our weapons".

He said the strike was carried out using a new drone called "Yafa", which he said was capable of bypassing interception systems and undetectable by radars.

"The operation has achieved its goals successfully," Saree said in a televised speech.

Israel's emergency services said the body of a 50 year-old man was found in an apartment close to the explosion and four people were taken to hospital with slight shrapnel injuries. REUTERS/Ricardo Moraes [Purchase Licensing Rights, opens new tab](https://www.reutersconnect.com/item/explosion-amid-the-israel-hamas-conflict-in-tel-aviv/dGFnOnJldXRlcnMuY29tLDIwMjQ6bmV3c21sX1JDMjZZOEFUSzBCVg%3D%3D/?utm_medium=rcom-article-media&utm_campaign=rcom-rcp-lead)

The military said air patrols had been increased to protect Israeli airspace but said it had not ordered new civil defence measures. All of them were later released, health services said.

Israel has been exchanging daily missile and artillery fire with Hezbollah along its northern border and in southern Lebanon since the start of the war in Gaza, prompting fears of a wider regional conflict if the situation escalates.

The Houthis have also stepped up attacks against Israel and Western targets, saying they are acting in solidarity with the Palestinians, after Israel invaded the Gaza Strip following last year's attack by Hamas militants on southern Israel.

Hamas-led fighters stormed Israeli towns on Oct. Since then, nearly 39,000 Palestinians have been killed in Israel's assault on the Gaza Strip, according to health authorities in the enclave.

DevelopPrompt - QUERY:

# Instructions
You just retrieved new Evidence. Now, **analyze the Claim's veracity using the evidence**. Always adhere to the following rules:
* Focus on developing new insights. Do not repeat larger parts from the Record. Do not restate the Claim.
* Write down your thoughts step-by-step. Whenever necessary, you may elaborate in more detail.
* Depending on the topic's complexity, invest one to three paragraphs. The fewer, the better.
* If you find that there is insufficient information to verify the Claim, explicitly state what information is missing.
* If you cite web sources, always refer to them by including their URL as a Markdown hyperlink.
* **Use information only from the recorded evidence**: Avoid inserting information that is not implied by the evidence. You may use commonsense knowledge, though.

# Record
## Claim
Claim: "<image:58> This image shows the aftermath of a Houthi attack on Tel Aviv, Israel, in July 2024."

## Actions
```
reverse_search(<image:58>)
geolocate(<image:58>)
web_search("Houthi attack Tel Aviv July 2024")
```

## Evidence
### Evidence from `reverse_search`
The image (<image:58>) appears in multiple sources. One source, from LBC Group, describes an explosion in a Tel Aviv building on July 19, 2024, with bomb disposal experts on site. ([https://www.lbcgroup.tv/news/middleeastnews/784660/explosion-in-tel-aviv-building-bomb-disposal-experts-on-site-israeli-p/en](https://www.lbcgroup.tv/news/middleeastnews/784660/explosion-in-tel-aviv-building-bomb-disposal-experts-on-site-israeli-p/en))

Another source, from The Times of Israel, uses the image in a live blog about the October 7, 2023, conflict. ([https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog-october-7-2023/](https://www.timesofisrael.com/liveblog-october-7-2023/)) A third source from India.com, published on October 22, 2024, uses the image in an article about Hezbollah firing rockets at Tel Aviv. ([https://www.india.com/news/israel-hezbollah-war-hezbollah-fires-20-rockets-at-israels-capital-tel-aviv-horrific-videos-go-viral-watch-7342129/](https://www.india.com/news/israel-hezbollah-war-hezbollah-fires-20-rockets-at-israels-capital-tel-aviv-horrific-videos-go-viral-watch-7342129/))


### Evidence from `geolocate`
The most likely countries where the image was taken are: {'Israel': 0.64, 'Palestine': 0.13, 'United Arab Emirates': 0.12, 'Jordan': 0.08, 'Tunisia': 0.01, 'Albania': 0.0, 'Andorra': 0.0, 'Argentina': 0.0, 'Australia': 0.0, 'Austria': 0.0}

### Evidence from `web_search`
The web sources discuss a Houthi attack on Tel Aviv, Israel. One source, from Wikipedia, details a drone attack on July 19, 2024, that targeted an apartment building, resulting in one death and ten injuries. The Houthis claimed responsibility for the attack. The article can be found here: [Source](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Houthi_drone_attack_on_Israel). <image:58>

Reuters reports that a long-range Iranian-made drone hit Tel Aviv on July 19, 2024, in an attack claimed by the Yemen-based Houthi militia, killing one man and wounding four others. The article includes a photograph of a damaged building. The article can be found here: [Source](https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/israeli-military-says-tel-aviv-blast-apparently-caused-by-drone-2024-07-19/). <image:131> The New York Times reports that Houthi militants launched a missile from Yemen that landed in Tel Aviv in December 2024, causing at least 16 injuries. The article can be found here: [Source](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/12/20/world/middleeast/israel-tel-aviv-missile-yemen.html).


# Your Analysis



===== > RESPONSE:  < =====
The claim is partially supported by the evidence. The reverse image search and web search results confirm that an attack occurred in Tel Aviv in July 2024. The web search results specifically mention a Houthi attack on July 19, 2024, which aligns with the claim. However, the image is also used in articles about other events, including the October 7, 2023, conflict and a December 2024 missile attack. Therefore, while the image is associated with an event in Tel Aviv, the claim's specific association with the July 2024 Houthi attack needs further verification to confirm the image's context.
